2.speaker: PENGUIN
2.english: Well, we are going camping. Camping {\i1}(kyanpu){\i0}?

5.speaker: PENGUIN
5.japanese: それは　バグパイプ

6.speaker: PENGUIN
6.japanese: それは　ゴーヤチャンプルー
6.english: That would be bitter melon champloo {\i1}(goya champuru){\i0}. {I don't know if "goya" is well known enough to not be translated?}

7.speaker: PANDA
7.japanese: 僕　キャンプって　したことないんだよ

8.speaker: POLAR BEAR
8.japanese: キャンプっていうのはね…

9.speaker: POLAR BEAR
9.japanese: 真っ暗な山の中で　ひっそり寂しく 冷たい地べたの上で寝るんだよ
9.english: you sleep in total darkness out in the mountains, alone and secluded on the cold, hard ground. Really?

10.speaker: PANDA
10.japanese: ペンギンさん　真っ暗なところで ひっそり寝るのが好きなの？
10.english: So, you like quietly sleeping in dark places, Mr. Penguin?

12.speaker: PENGUIN
12.japanese: キャンプっていうのは大自然のなかでおいしいご飯食べて
12.english: Camping is when you're out in nature, eating delicious food pitching a tent,

13.speaker: PENGUIN
13.japanese: テント張ってきれいな星空眺めたりするものでしょ！
13.english: and gazing at all the pretty stars in the sky!

14.speaker: PANDA
14.japanese: 笹か竹があればいいよ
14.english: As long as there's bamboo grass or bamboo.

15.speaker: PENGUIN
15.japanese: それじゃ いつもと変わらないじゃない…
15.english: That's no different from any other time.

16.speaker: POLAR BEAR
16.japanese: もうすぐ　グリズリーくんも来るよ
16.english: Grizzly will be here soon, too.

18.speaker: POLAR BEAR
18.japanese: 草むしりのとき　来てたよ
18.english: He was here when we were weeding.

20.speaker: PENGUIN
20.japanese: あぁ！　あの　パーッと来て ピューッて帰ったクマね
20.english: Oh, that bear that came in like, "rawr" and left like, "whoosh."

22.speaker: PANDA
22.japanese: おはよう　グリズリーさん

23.speaker: GRIZZLY
23.japanese: おっ！　パンダも行くのか

24.speaker: GRIZZLY
24.japanese: このちっちぇえのは　鳥か？
24.english: The hell is this small thing, a bird?

26.speaker: GRIZZLY
26.japanese: ちっちゃくて わかんなかったぜ

27.speaker: PENGUIN
27.japanese: コウテイペンギンは　ペンギン界のなかでは 最大のペンギンだよ！
27.english: Emperor penguins are the greatest among all penguins!

28.speaker: GRIZZLY
28.japanese: クマより　ちっちぇえのに 変わりはないだろう？
28.english: You're still smaller than a bear.

30.speaker: PENGUIN
30.japanese: あのクマ！　失礼しちゃうな

31.speaker: PANDA
31.japanese: グリズリーさん わりと　ざっくりしてるからね
31.english: Mr. Grizzly doesn't think about what he says.

32.speaker: PENGUIN
32.english: I don't want to hear that from you.

34.speaker: PENGUIN
34.japanese: さすが　大自然は気持いいね
34.english: It feels great to be in the great outdoors!

35.speaker: PENGUIN
35.japanese: よし！　じゃあ　まず…

36.speaker: GRIZZLY
36.japanese: キャンプの係を決めようぜ！
36.english: Let's decide on who's in charge of the camp. Hey! Hey! Don't jump in so abruptly!

37.speaker: GRIZZLY
37.japanese: いいだろ？ 別に　誰が仕切っても

40.speaker: POLAR BEAR
40.english: I'm reading a book in the great outdoors.

41.speaker: PANDA
41.japanese: え～　どうしたの？ あっ！　もう　ご飯の時間？
41.english: Huh? What's going on? Oh, is it already time to eat? No, it's not.

42.speaker: GRIZZLY
42.japanese: とっとと準備しねえと 日が暮れちまうぞ
42.english: If we don't set up soon, it's going to get dark.

43.speaker: PANDA
43.japanese: きちんと 準備しようよ　ペンギンさん
43.english: Yeah, let's get set up, Mr. Penguin.

44.speaker: PENGUIN
44.japanese: 今　その話をしていたんだよ！
44.english: That's what we were just saying! First, let's decide on who's in charge of what, Grizzly.

45.speaker: GRIZZLY
45.japanese: だから　そう言ってんだろ！
45.english: That's what I was just saying!

46.speaker: PANDA
46.english: What are we going to do first?

47.speaker: GRIZZLY
47.japanese: まずはテントの設営だな　それから　火起こし　調理飯炊きは分担するか
47.english: First, we have to pitch the tent. Then we can divide up the duties of making a fire, preparing the food, and making the rice.

48.speaker: PANDA
48.japanese: じゃあ…　ご飯ができたら起こして
48.english: Okay, wake me up when the food's ready.

49.speaker: GRIZZLY
49.japanese: おい！　パンダくんもやるの！

52.speaker: POLAR BEAR
52.english: So, who's in charge of what?

54.speaker: GRIZZLY
54.japanese: テントはみんなで　火起こしはシロクマ
54.english: Pitching the tent: everyone. Making the fire: Polar Bear.

55.speaker: GRIZZLY
55.japanese: 調理が俺で　飯炊きはペンギンだ
55.english: I'll prepare the food, and the penguin will make the rice.

56.speaker: PENGUIN
56.japanese: ちょっと！ 勝手にどんどん決めないでよ
56.english: Hey, don't just decide for everyone.

57.speaker: GRIZZLY
57.japanese: 細けぇこと　気にすんなよ　鳥！
57.english: Don't sweat the small stuff, bird.

60.speaker: GRIZZLY
60.japanese: お前は手伝い係ってとこか？
60.english: You'll be something like the helper.

61.speaker: POLAR BEAR
61.japanese: じゃあ　まずはテント張ろう
61.english: Well, let's get the tent up first.

64.speaker: GRIZZLY
64.japanese: それ　テントじゃねえだろ！
64.english: That's not a tent! All done.

65.speaker: PANDA
65.japanese: いつもは野暮ったいペンギンさんが 輝いてみえるよ
65.english: You're shining right now, Mr. Penguin, even though you're usually so drab.

66.speaker: PENGUIN
66.japanese: パンダくん そういう感想はいらないから
66.english: Comments like that aren't needed, Panda.

67.speaker: POLAR BEAR
67.japanese: じゃあ　中に入ってみよう
67.english: Well then, let's go inside. Yeah.

69.speaker: PENGUIN
69.japanese: これは全員入るのはムリだね
69.english: It's not going to be possible for all of us to fit. What are we going to do, Polar Bear?!

71.speaker: PANDA
71.english: What are we going to do?

72.speaker: POLAR BEAR
72.japanese: テントをもう一つ持ってきたから ２つ建てよう
72.english: I brought another tent, so pitch it, too.

74.speaker: PENGUIN
74.english: You should have told us earlier!

75.speaker: GRIZzLY
75.japanese: さぁ　夕食の支度するぞ
75.english: Well then, I'm going to prepare dinner.

79.speaker: PENGUIN
79.japanese: シロクマくんは　マスじゃなくて 薪を集めてよ！
79.english: You need to collect firewood, not trout, Polar Bear!

80.speaker: PENGUIN
80.japanese: 火起こし係なんだから！
80.english: You're in charge of making the fire!

81.speaker: PENGUIN
81.japanese: みんな　真面目に 自分の係やってほしいよ
81.english: Why can't everyone do what they're supposed to? Got that right.

82.speaker: PENGUIN
82.japanese: アチッ！　アチチチ！ うわっ　アチッ！

83.speaker: PENGUIN
83.japanese: ちょっと　やめてよ！ 火が　はぜるでしょ！
83.english: Hey, stop that! You're making the fire spark!

84.speaker: PANDA
84.japanese: え～　せっかく　集めてきたのに
84.english: Aw, but I worked so hard to get some.

85.speaker: GRIZZLY
85.english: What the hell are you doing?!

86.speaker: PENGUIN
86.japanese: 切り株はやめてよ！ むしろ　火が消えちゃうよ
86.english: Don't put a stump in there! You're going to end up putting the fire out!

87.speaker: POLAR BEAR
87.japanese: せっかく　集めてきたのに
87.english: But I worked so hard to get it.

88.speaker: GRIZZLY
88.japanese: まったく　パンダもシロクマも…
88.english: What the hell is wrong with Polar Bear and Panda?

93.speaker: PENGUIN
93.japanese: キャンプの定番だよね

94.speaker: PANDA
94.english: Oh, I know! For the secret ingredient.

95.speaker: GRIZZLY
95.english: Don't you dare put that in!

96.speaker: PANDA
96.japanese: 笹がないカレーなんて…
96.english: I can't imagine curry without bamboo grass...

97.speaker: PENGUIN
97.english: There isn't any in normal curry!

98.speaker: GRIZZLY
98.japanese: まったく　油断も隙もねえ
98.english: Damn it, we can't let our guard down for a second.

100.speaker: GRIZZLY
100.japanese: 余計なもん 入れんなって言ってんだろ！
100.english: We just said stop putting unnecessary things in there!

101.speaker: POLAR BEAR
101.japanese: シーフードカレーにしようかと…
101.english: I thought we'd make it seafood curry.

102.speaker: PENGUIN
102.japanese: シーじゃなくて レークになっちゃうでしょ
102.english: This isn't the sea. It's a lake.

103.speaker: PANDA
103.japanese: ねぇ 焦げ臭くない？

105.speaker: GRIZZLY
105.japanese: アイツらかまってて　忘れてたな
105.english: We watching those idiotsso much, we forgot.

107.speaker: GRIZZLY
107.english: Don't worry about it. Hey! I brought flour.

108.speaker: GRIZZLY
108.japanese: カレーだし　ナンでも焼くか
108.english: Well, since we're having curry, how about we make some naan? Okay.

110.speaker: POLAR BEAR
110.japanese: 苦労して作った甲斐があるね
110.english: A great reward for all the hard work we put in.

111.speaker: PANDA
111.japanese: シロクマくん　すご～い！
111.english: Wow, you're amazing, Polar Bear! It's not pizza!

113.speaker: PENGUIN
113.japanese: おもに作ったのは 僕とグリズリーくんだけど…
113.english: Grizzly and I did most of the work. Exactly.

117.speaker: GRIZZLY
117.japanese: ペンギン　お前から入れよ

118.speaker: GRIZZLY
118.japanese: お前が　いちばん働いたからな

120.speaker: GRIZZLY
120.japanese: どうだ？　湯かげんは
120.english: How is it? How's the temperature?

121.speaker: PENGUIN
121.japanese: 本当は　あったかいお風呂より 冷たいほうがいいけど…
121.english: Honestly, I'd prefer a cold bath instead of a hot one.

123.speaker: GRIZZLY
123.japanese: そうか　ま　あったまれよ
123.english: Good to hear. Well, warm up.

126.speaker: PENGUIN
126.japanese: パンダくん　煮えてるよ！

128.speaker: PENGUIN
128.japanese: シロクマくん　最初から言ってよ！
128.english: You should have told me that first, Polar Bear!

129.speaker: GRIZZLY
129.english: Guess we should head to bed.

130.speaker: POLAR BEAR
130.japanese: じゃあ　誰と誰が同じテントになるか　くじ引きしよう
130.english: In that case, let's draw straws to decide who will share a tent.

131.speaker: GRIZZLY
131.japanese: みんな　１本ずつ引いてくれ

132.speaker: PANDA
132.english: Mine has a leaf! The first tent will be Polar Bear and Panda.

133.speaker: GRIZZLY
133.japanese: もうひとつは俺とお前だな
133.english: The other will be you and me.

134.speaker: GRIZZLY
134.english: Thanks for all your hard work today.

136.speaker: GRIZZLY
136.english: It must be hard for you, too.

138.speaker: GRIZZLY
138.japanese: ったく　シロクマもパンダも 何もしやしねえどころか
138.english: Not only do Polar Bear and Panda do nothing,

139.speaker: GRIZZLY
139.japanese: 面倒ばかりかけやがるからな
139.english: they cause more work for the rest of us.

143.speaker: GRIZZLY
143.japanese: 放っとけねえんだよな

144.speaker: GRIZZLY
144.japanese: 飲むか　とっておきの 持ってきたんだよ
144.english: Want to drink? I brought my special reserves.

146.speaker: GRIZZLY
146.japanese: 俺たちも苦労するよな
146.english: We go through so much trouble!

148.speaker: PENGUIN
148.japanese: まったくだよ　面倒見きれないよ！
148.english: So true! We can't watch after you guys all the time!

153.speaker: POLAR BEAR
153.japanese: こんなところで寝てると 風邪ひくよ
153.english: You'll catch a cold sleeping out here.

154.speaker: POLAR BEAR
154.japanese: もう　ペンギンさんも グリズリーくんもホントに…
154.english: Jeez, Mr. Penguin and Grizzly are so... ...troublesome, aren't they?

155.speaker: BOTH
155.english: That would be... the two of you!

156.speaker: PENGUIN
156.japanese: 笹子さん　人間の鼻の下の溝は 何のためにあるの？
156.english: Miss Sasako, what purpose does the groove below humans' noses serve? You know, I'm not really sure.

157.speaker: PANDA
157.japanese: ペンギンさん　ペンギンさん 何　パンダくん
157.english: Mr. Penguin, Mr. Penguin. What is it, Panda?

158.speaker: PANDA
158.japanese: ペンギンさんって カフェでいつもダラダラしてるけど
158.english: You're always lazing around this café,

159.speaker: PANDA
159.japanese: たまには僕みたいに ちゃんと働いたほうがいいよ
159.english: but you should try working like me sometime.

160.speaker: PENGUIN
160.japanese: キミに言われたくないってことで いいかな
160.english: How about I just say I'd rather not hear that from you?

161.speaker: PENGUIN
161.japanese: そういうパンダくんこそ 今日バイトじゃないの？
161.english: Speaking of, don't you have work today?

163.speaker: PANDA
163.japanese: 週２は　キツイから 午後からにしたんだ
163.english: It's really hard working two days a week, so I said I'd be coming in the afternoon.

164.speaker: PENGUIN
164.japanese: よくクビにならないね
164.english: I'm amazed that you haven't been fired yet.

165.speaker: POLAR BEAR
165.japanese: あれ　パンダくん来てたの

167.speaker: POLAR BEAR
167.japanese: はい　これ　パンダくんに

168.speaker: PANDA
168.japanese: 何　今日パンダの日
168.english: What? Is it Panda Day today?

169.speaker: PENGUIN
169.english: What kind of day is that?

170.speaker: PENGUIN
170.japanese: シロクマくん　これどうしたの？
170.english: Where'd you get this, Polar Bear?

172.speaker: RIN RIN
172.japanese: パンダくんに 渡してください

177.speaker: PANDA
177.japanese: うん　僕に何の恨みがあるんだろう
177.english: Yeah. I wonder what he has against me.

178.speaker: PENGUIN
178.japanese: 花くれてるだけじゃない

179.speaker: RIN RIN
179.japanese: パンダくん　喜んでくれたかな？
179.english: I hope Panda liked those flowers.

180.speaker: GIRL
180.japanese: あっ… 厘太郎さんだ…
180.english: Look! It's the florist! Welcome. Could I get this, please?

181.speaker: GIRL2
181.japanese: すみません　これください
181.english: Excuse me, could I get this?

182.speaker: RIN RIN
182.japanese: ありがとうございました

183.speaker: GIRL
183.japanese: 厘太郎さん いつ見ても　ステキ…
183.english: Mr. Rintarou is always so amazing.

188.speaker: RIN RIN
188.japanese: 今から　僕に つきあってくれないかな？
188.english: Could we go somewhere together? W-W-W-W-What am I going to do?! Mr. Rintarou just asked me out!

189.speaker: GIRL
189.japanese: これって…　デート？ ど…　ど…　ど…　どうしよう…
189.english: Is this a date? W-W-W-W-What am I going to do?!

190.speaker: GIRL
190.japanese: でも　どうして私なんて…

191.speaker: GIRL
191.japanese: あんなステキな女の人たちが たくさんいるのに
191.english: There's all those other pretty girls. Is it my plainness?

192.speaker: GIRL
192.japanese: 女子高生の地味さが勝ったの？
192.english: Could it be the plainness of being a high school student won out?

193.speaker: GIRL
193.japanese: デート…　厘太郎さんが 私を　デートに…
193.english: Wow, Mr. Rintarou asked me out.

194.speaker: RIN RIN
194.english: Is it all right? Can you go?

196.speaker: GIRL
196.japanese: センスがいい 厘太郎さんのことだから
196.english: Since Mr. Rintarou has such good taste,

197.speaker: GIRL
197.japanese: きっと　すごくステキなところに…
197.english: he must be taking me to a wonderful place.

198.speaker: TEACHER
198.japanese: は～い　みんな ゾウさんですよ

200.speaker: GIRL
200.japanese: あっ…　いえ　意外で…
200.english: Oh, it was just a little unexpected.

206.speaker: RIN RIN
206.japanese: どうしたの？ 何でも聞いていいよ
206.english: What is it? You can ask me anything.

207.speaker: GIRL
207.japanese: あの…　厘太郎さんの恋人って　ステキな人なんでしょうね
207.english: Um, your girlfriend must be a wonderful person.

208.speaker: RIN RIN
208.japanese: 恋人は　いないんだ

209.speaker: GIRL
209.japanese: えっ…　そうなんですか？

210.speaker: RIN RIN
210.japanese: でも　僕を 夢中にさせてくれる人はいるよ
210.english: But there is someone I can't stop thinking about.

211.speaker: GIRL
211.japanese: それって　もしかして…

212.speaker: GIRL
212.japanese: と…　歳の差は　いいんですか？

213.speaker: RIN RIN
213.japanese: 歳の差？　そういうのは 考えたことないな
213.english: Age gap? I never even thought about that.

215.speaker: GIRL
215.japanese: その人って どんな人なんですか？

216.speaker: RIN RIN
216.japanese: 白と黒が　かわいくて…
216.english: Well, black and white looks really cute on them.

217.speaker: GIRL
217.english: My uniform? He has a uniform fetish?

218.speaker: GIRL
218.japanese: いい…　それでも　全然いい！
218.english: That's okay. I'm totally okay with that.

220.speaker: GIRL
220.japanese: これだ！　ツインテだ
220.english: He must be talking about my pigtails!

221.speaker: GIRL
221.japanese: 偉い！　偉いよ　私！

223.speaker: GIRL
223.japanese: ポテチだ… ポテチを食べすぎた…
223.english: It's the potato chips. I ate too many potato chips!

224.speaker: GIRL
224.japanese: ダメ…　ダメよ　私…

225.speaker: RIN RIN
225.japanese: ゴロゴロしてる姿が たまらなくて…
225.english: And they're so cute sprawled out. Peeping? Is he secretly taking photos of me?

226.speaker: RIN RIN
226.japanese: そんな…　パンダくんに最高に夢中なんだ
226.english: All that... is why I love Panda so much.

229.speaker: PANDA
229.japanese: リンリン　また来てる

230.speaker: RIN RIN
230.japanese: ねぇ　ねぇ　キミ　ちょっと　これ　お願い
230.english: And so, could you take care of this for me?

232.speaker: RIN RIN
232.japanese: パンダくんと一緒に撮った写真 初めてだよ！
232.english: That's the first time I took a picture with Panda.

233.speaker: RIN RIN
233.japanese: キミに来てもらって　よかったよ
233.english: I'm so happy you came with me.

235.speaker: RIN RIN
235.japanese: キミ　パンダ好きでしょ？　それ見て　すぐわかったよ
235.english: You like pandas, too, right? I could totally tell by that.

236.speaker: RIN RIN
236.japanese: パンダ好きは パンダ好きを知るんだよね
236.english: Those who like pandas can tell others who like pandas.

238.speaker: GIRL
238.japanese: なに　このテンション…

239.speaker: GIRL
239.japanese: ホントに　あの厘太郎さん？
239.english: Is this really Mr. Rintarou? But... if pandas get me closer to Mr. Rintarou...

242.speaker: RIN RIN
242.japanese: かわいいのは あっちのパンダさんじゃなくて　こっちのパンダくん！
242.english: The one that's cute isn't the panda there, but Panda over there!

244.speaker: RIN RIN
244.japanese: いいかい？　よ～く見てごらん

245.speaker: RIN RIN
245.japanese: ボーッとしてないで見て

247.speaker: RIN RIN
247.japanese: あっちのパンダさんと　こっちのパンダくん
247.english: Mr. Panda there, and Panda there.

248.speaker: RIN RIN
248.japanese: あっちのパンダさんと　こっちのパンダくん
248.english: Mr. Panda there, and Panda there.

250.speaker: GIRL
250.japanese: 全然　違いがわからない…
250.english: I can't tell the difference at all.

252.speaker: GIRL
252.japanese: ホント　こっちのパンダのが　かわいい
252.english: Um... that panda over there is much cuter.

256.speaker: RIN RIN
256.japanese: 一緒に　パンダくんの どこがかわいいか
256.english: How about we spend another hour

257.speaker: RIN RIN
257.japanese: 小一時間　語り合わないか？
257.english: talking about Panda's cuteness together? Huh?

259.speaker: RIN RIN
259.japanese: あのモフモフした顔見た？
259.english: Did you see his fluffy face?

260.speaker: RIN RIN
260.japanese: 僕は見たよ！　どうしよう！？
260.english: I totally saw it! What am I going to do?

261.speaker: RIN RIN
261.japanese: あんな かわいいものってあるかな？

263.speaker: RIN RIN
263.japanese: できるならパンダコーナーで パンダくんと一緒に住みたいよね
263.english: If it was possible, I'd want to live with Panda in the panda corner.

264.speaker: RIN RIN
264.japanese: いいな　それ！　どうしよう
264.english: That'd be great. What would I do?

265.speaker: RIN RIN
265.japanese: ああ　だけど パンダくん　週２日のバイトだから
265.english: But Panda only works two days a week,

268.speaker: RIN RIN
268.japanese: パンダくんの かわいい転がってる姿を間近で見られるなんて 最高だよね！
268.english: ...Being able to see him cutely rolling around up close is so amazing, isn't it?

271.speaker: RIN RIN
271.japanese: 滑り台を滑ってるパンダ君もとびきり可愛いよね
271.english: but Panda sliding down his slide is totally cute, too, isn't it?

272.speaker: SPEAKER
272.japanese: 閉園の時間になりました
272.english: {\a6}We are now closed. {\a6}We look forward to your next visit.

274.speaker: RIN RIN
274.japanese: ごめんね　長くなっちゃったね
274.english: I'm sorry, this ended up being really long.

277.speaker: GIRL
277.english: Yes. Let's go somewhere else and continue our discussion.

280.speaker: GIRL
280.japanese: あっ　いえ　あの 私　宿題あるから　失礼します！
280.english: Oh, uh, I have homework! Gotta go!

281.speaker: RIN RIN
281.japanese: ああ　キミ　ちょっと待って！

282.speaker: RIN RIN
282.japanese: パンダくんの話しようよ！
282.english: Let's talk more about Panda! You can have this.

283.speaker: RIN RIN
283.japanese: いいの？　ありがとう！ 一生　恩に着るよ！
283.english: Really? Thank you! I owe you for a lifetime! It's okay. A lifetime is a bit extreme...

287.speaker: GIRL
287.japanese: さようなら！　私の恋！

288.speaker: RIN RIN
288.japanese: またパンダの話しようね！

289.speaker: GIRL
289.japanese: さようなら　私の恋！

290.speaker: RIN RIN
290.japanese: これ　返せって言っても 返さないからね！
290.english: I'm not... giving this back, even if you ask!

294.speaker: PANDA
294.japanese: やっぱり 労働って半日もきついな
294.english: A half day of manual labor is rough.

295.speaker: PANDA
295.japanese: なんとか 半日の半分にしてもらおう
295.english: I'm going to ask if they'd make it only half of half a day.

296.speaker: PENGUIN
296.japanese: キミ　クビになってもいいのにね
296.english: I think it'd be okay to fire you.

298.speaker: PANDA
298.japanese: あっ　リンリンの花！ どっかにやってよ
298.english: Oh, Rin Rin's flowers! Could you move them?

299.speaker: POLAR BEAR
299.japanese: まぁまぁ　きれいな花じゃない

300.speaker: PANDA
300.japanese: ペンギンさん　ペンギンさん

302.speaker: PANDA
302.japanese: ぺんぎんさんは死の特訓してでも　必殺技の一つでも身につけたいとか考えないの
302.english: Don't you ever feel like you wanted to learn a special move, even if that meant you'd have to go through life-threatening training?

303.speaker: PENGUIN
303.english: I don't think I do. For example, the ability to imitate a fax machine.

304.speaker: PENGUIN
304.japanese: 死の特訓してまで手に入れたくない技だね
304.english: That's definitely not something I'd go through life-threatening training for. Polar Bear, let's end this.

305.speaker: POLAR BEAR
305.japanese: 次回　しろくまカフェ　対　world　business　satellite
305.english: Next time, Polar Bear's Café vs. World Business Satellite.

306.speaker: PENGUIN
306.japanese: しろくまカフェって普通に言えないのかな
306.english: Can't you just say, "Polar Bear's Café"?
